description:
The course sets out to do the follows. 1) Give a historical overview of feminist film theory and queer film theory. 2) Engage with some of the key concepts crucial to the understanding of queer cinematic practices. 3) Survey some of the landmark titles in the history of queer cinema. 4) Introduce contemporary Chinese language cinemas with queer subject matters.
本課程以結構主義理論為起點，先介紹電影女性主義演變至酷兒理論濫觴之軌跡，再介紹後現代文化與酷兒運動謀合及分歧之處。同時勾勒世界酷兒電影（glbtq）歷史的輪廓，世界重要的酷兒影像（queer images），酷兒理論及文化全球化後對華人同志社群、運動及論述的影響，以及現今電影酷兒影像主流化的現象。

_course description_

The course sets out to do the following: 1) give a historical overview of feminist film theory and queer film theory; 2) engage with key concepts crucial to the understanding of queer cinematic practices; 3) survey some of the landmark titles in the history of queer cinema; 4) introduce East Asian or Chinese language queer images and cultures.

_requirements_

1.  grade (subject to change)

attendance and regular participation in discussion. Unexcused absences can affect your grade. Read assigned materials _before_ class and be prepared to give _considered_ response and _talk_ in class (15%)

3-5 pop quizzes (15%)

a 20 min group or individual presentation on an assigned topic AND its write-up (25%)

a 25 min individual final presentation (15%)

final paper (30%)

2.  you receive _a hefty penalty or even failing grade_ if you

have 5 or more unexcused absences

cause disturbance or interruption of lecture because of _any_ mobile device

commit _plagiarism_ of any form

3.  unless they are legitimately excused, final papers are allowed to be 48 hours late for loss of a letter grade; after 48 hours they will not be accepted and will be graded F.
